description.content:
Retrieves the list of transactions (statement) for a specific budget within the VTEX Budget API.

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).
Page number of the results.
Number of items per page.
(Required) Type of context for the budget (e.g., `UNIT`). This field can't be updated, it is used for validation. You must send the original value.
(Required) Identifier of the corresponding Unit. This field can't be updated, it is used for validation. You must send the original value.
(Required) Identifier of the budget.
(Required) HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.
Page number of the results.
Number of items per page.
(Required) HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Page number of the results.
Number of items per page.
(Required) HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

Number of items per page.

Refunds a specific transaction from a budget allocation by creating a new **`CREDIT`** statement item, which adds funds back to the specified budget allocation.

This endpoint deletes a specific allocation from a budget.

> Allocations are not definitively deleted, they are maintained for the sake of record keeping. When looking at statements you will be able to see transaction history for deleted allocations.

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).
(Required) Type of context for the budget (e.g., `UNIT`). This field can't be updated, it is used for validation. You must send the original value.
(Required) Identifier of the corresponding Unit. This field can't be updated, it is used for validation. You must send the original value.
(Required) Identifier of the budget.
(Required) Identifier of the allocation.
(Required) HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

response.name:
OK

The allocation was successfully deleted.

Page number of the results.
Number of items per page.
Minimum budget amount for filtering.
Maximum budget amount for filtering.
Filter by status (e.g., `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`).

A budget is a financial management tool that enables organizations to plan and monitor expenses, ensuring resources are allocated efficiently and in compliance with strategic criteria.

The Budget API is a comprehensive budget management service that allows you to create, manage, and control budgets, allocations, transactions, and reservations.

This endpoints' collection manages the expenses of your store, promoting financial transparency, traceability, and control.

## Budget and Allocation

Each Budget can have one or more **Allocations**, which are subdivisions of the total balance within that budget.

Each **Budget** and **Allocation** has its own **amount**, **start date**, and **end date**. When funds are added to or removed from an Allocation, the corresponding Budget's total amount is updated accordingly to reflect the change.

## Transactions and Reservations

To move funds from an Allocation, there are two options:

- **Direct Transaction**  
    Used when you want to actually consume the balance. This creates a definitive entry that appears in the **Statements** (transaction history).
    
- **Reservation**  
    Used to temporarily reserve funds without consuming them immediately. Later, you can either:
    
    - **Confirm the reservation**, which automatically creates a transaction.
        
    - **Delete the reservation**, which simply releases the reserved balance without generating any transaction (it does not appear in the Statements).
        

## Refunds

Transactions cannot be deleted. If you need to undo a transaction, you must create a **Refund**, which is a new transaction with the type. Both the original transaction and the refund will appear in the Statements, with a net effect of zero.

## Transaction types

When you get a budget or allocation statement, each transaction contains a `type` field, which can carry two values:

- `DEBIT`: Regular transactions, subtracting funds from the budget or allocation.
    
- `CREDIT`: Associated with refunds, meaning it adds funds to the budget or allocation.
    

## Typical API Call Order

1. Create the **Budget**
    
2. Create one or more **Allocations**
    
3. Perform a **Transaction** or a **Reservation**
    
4. Retrieve the transaction history using the **Statements** endpoints
    

> In a typical purchase flow, we do not use Reservations. We create direct Transactions and use Refunds when needed.

## Index

### Statements
- `GET` [Get Budget Statements](#get-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/statements)
- `GET` [Get Allocation Statements](#get-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations/{allocationId}/statements)

### Transactions
- `POST` [Create Transaction](#post-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations/{allocationId}/transactions)
- `POST` [Refund Transaction](#post-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations/{allocationId}/transactions/{transactionId}/refund)
- `GET` [Get Transaction](#get-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations/{allocationId}/transactions/{transactionId})

### Reservations
- `POST` [Create Reservation](#post-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations/{allocationId}/reservations)
- `POST` [Confirmation Reservation](#post-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations/{allocationId}/reservations/{reservationId}/confirmation)
- `DELETE` [Delete Reservation](#delete-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations/{allocationId}/reservations/{reservationId})
- `GET` [Get Reservation](#get-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations/{allocationId}/reservations/{reservationId})
- `GET` [List Reservations](#get-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations/{allocationId}/reservations)

### Allocations
- `POST` [Create Allocation](#post-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations)
- `POST` [Create Batch of Allocations](#post-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations/batch)
- `PUT` [Update Allocation](#put-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations/{allocationId})
- `DELETE` [Delete Allocation](#delete-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations/{allocationId})
- `GET` [Get Allocation](#get-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations/{allocationId})
- `POST` [Query Allocations](#post-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/allocations/query)
- `GET` [List Budget Allocations](#get-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations)
- `PUT` [Change Allocation Status](#put-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations/{allocationId}/status)
- `PUT` [Update Allocation Usage](#put-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/allocations/{allocationId}/usage)

### Budgets
- `POST` [Create Budget](#post-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId})
- `PUT` [Update Budget](#put-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId})
- `PUT` [Update Budget Status](#put-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId}/status)
- `GET` [Get Budget](#get-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId})
- `GET` [List Budgets](#get-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId})
- `DELETE` [Delete Budget](#delete-/api/budgets/{contextType}/{contextId}/{budgetId})

## Common parameters in the documentation

| Parameter name | Description |
| - | - |
| `{{accountName}}` | Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL. |
| `{{environment}}` | Environment to use. Used as part of the URL. |
| `{{VtexIdclientAutCookie}}` | [User token](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/api-authentication-using-user-tokens), valid for 24 hours. |
